page.title: 20HOUSING IN ARNPRIOR
page.content: The houses of the Arnprior district are mainly old and constructed of stone.(The row of council houses were built of steel in the 1950's.)There have been no houses built recently. Many of the farm houses date from the late 19th century and some are much older,the home farm-house being a beautiful Georgian building. However, many houses, including estate cottages, have been extensively modernised in the last year or so, with standards of heating and insulation being enhanced. Common electrical household equipment includes washing machines, tumble driers, dish washers, tv's, videos, fridge/freezers, cleaners, hair driers, and micro-computers. The internal environment combines the new with the old. (Text by Mrs M Begg and primaries 5,6&7,Arnprior School.1985)
